author: Björn Ritzl
description: Share application data using native sharing dialogs.
name: Share

releases.message: FIX: Removed unsupported platforms from ext.manifest
FIX: Updated to Defold 1.9.0
CHANGE: Updated to support Emscripten 3.1 used in Defold 1.7.1
FIX: Updated extension to work with newer Gradle version

CHANGE: For sharing images in HTML5 builds the mime type is now guessed from the file extension, unless sharing the image as a DataURL in which case the mime type is expected to be part of the data url.
FIX: When calling `share.file()` on html5 with title, text or url set to null they were in fact sent as empty strings as opposed to not sent at all. Thanks @sergeysinyavsky
NEW: HTML5 support. Thanks to @sergeysinyavsky
CHANGE: Updated gradle dependency to use androidx.core:core:1.6.+
FIX: Changed Android dependency to fix a build error
NEW: Updated to Android X
CHANGE: The extension now uses Gradle to resolve dependencies. Please update your game.project library dependencies and remove the previously required Google Play Services dependency.
FIX: Updated android manifest stub to solve issues when merging with main manifest
BREAKING CHANGE: This extension now needs the Google Play Services extension as a dependency (`extension-gps`)
FIX: Crash/conflict with other extension using FileProvider on Android
NEW: Use of the new manifest merge support in Defold. No need to create your own custom AndroidManifest.xml or Info.plist.

CHANGE: Updated included AndroidManifest.xml to match the one in /builtins
NEW: Added Info.plist with sharing descriptions
FIX: Improved stability on Android. Thanks @Lerg!
CHANGE: Files are shared using their original filename and extension. This will allow iOS to offer different sharing options based on the file type.
FIX: Crash when sharing on an iPad
NEW: Added file sharing via `share.file(path, [text])`
NEW: It's now possible to pass an optional text when sharing an image
FIX: Library folder wasn't correctly specified
NEW: Working Android support
